This property verifies that the interrupt request signal `irq` correctly reflects the logical AND of bits `TSR[7]` and `TCR[7]` when both bits are set to 1.

The property triggers on every positive edge of the clock signal `clk` and is disabled when the reset signal `rst` is active high (equal to 1).

When both `TSR[7]` and `TCR[7]` are equal to 1, the property requires that the `irq` signal must immediately equal the result of the bitwise AND operation between `TSR[7]` and `TCR[7]` (which will always be 1 in this condition).

# SVA Generation Chain-of-Thought

**Property:** p_irq_blocking_assign
**Type:** Assertion

## Step 1: Interface & Clock Domain Analysis

* **Signals:**
    * Design Signals: `TCR`, `TSR`, `irq`

* **Clocks & Resets:**
    * Primary Clock: `clk` (posedge)
    * Reset Signal: `rst` (Active High)

* **Cross-Domain Check:** 
    * Single clock domain - no CDC concerns

## Step 2: Semantic Mapping (Primitives & Built-ins)

* **Boolean Conditions:**
    * Trigger condition: `(TSR[7] == 1 && TCR[7] == 1)`
    * Response condition: `irq == (TSR[7] & TCR[7])`

## Step 3: Sequence Construction (Bottom-Up)

* **Sequence A (Trigger/Antecedent):**
    * Description: The triggering condition that initiates property evaluation
    * Logic: `(TSR[7] == 1 && TCR[7] == 1)`

* **Sequence B (Response/Consequent):**
    * Description: The expected behavior when trigger occurs
    * Logic: `irq == (TSR[7] & TCR[7])`

## Step 4: Property Assembly

* **Implication Type:**
    * Overlapping (`|->`) - consequent evaluation starts in the same cycle as antecedent match

* **Disable Condition:**
    * `disable iff (rst == 1)`
    * Property is disabled when reset `rst` is active high

* **Assertion Structure:**
    * `@(posedge clk) (TSR[7] == 1 && TCR[7] == 1) |-> irq == (TSR[7] & TCR[7])`

## Step 5: Final SVA Code

```systemverilog
property p_irq_blocking_assign;
    @(posedge clk) disable iff (rst == 1)
        (TSR[7] == 1 && TCR[7] == 1) |-> irq == (TSR[7] & TCR[7]);
endproperty
assert_p_irq_blocking_assign: assert property (p_irq_blocking_assign) else $error("Assertion failed: irq signal does not reflect the correct state when TSR[7] and TCR[7] are both set to 1");
```

**Summary:**
Property `p_irq_blocking_assign` uses overlapping implication synchronized to `clk`.
